intro: Aphania loheri, commonly known as the narrowleaf false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually blue to purple in color, and it produces narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Aphania loheri is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
